Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant has a fairly arguable case to justify judicial review of the PRRA officer's decision denying humanitarian and compassionate grounds for permanent residence
Procedural_Context: Judicial review application following denial of permanent residence on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant claimed personalized risk due to compulsory military service in Albania but failed to provide supporting evidence
Evidence_Type: Lack of supporting evidence for claimed risk
Legal_Provision: Subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Basis_of_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds for permanent residence
Evaluation_Standard: Fairly arguable case for judicial review
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to provide evidence supporting personalized risk claim
Proceeding_Type: Application for leave to seek judicial review
Application_Factor: Exhaustion of all recourse avenues since 2002
Decision_Outcome: Denial of permanent residence on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Decision_Review_Issue: Justification for judicial review of PRRA decision
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Outcome_of_Review: No serious question raised; application dismissed
Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to meet the fairly arguable case threshold
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of evidence to support claim of personalized risk
Credibility_Issues: Applicant's claim not supported by evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Application for judicial review based on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
